New Records: Kevin De Bruyne scored and assisted in Belgium's 2-0 win over Romania, contributing to their crucial victory at Euro 2024.
Key Match Events: Kevin De Bruyne scored the second goal for Belgium in the 80th minute after a long kick from goalkeeper Koen Casteels.
Youri Tielemans scored Belgium's first goal in the second minute with a low drive from the edge of the area.
Romelu Lukaku had a goal ruled out by VAR after being checked for an offside position.
Pre-Game Insights: Belgium needed a win to avoid early elimination after their opening loss to Slovakia.
The match was watched by Belgium's royal family, including King Philippe and Queen Mathilde.
Post-Match Reflections: Belgium's coach Domenico Tedesco expressed relief at the win and mentioned that more goals could have been scored to seal the game earlier.
The victory lifted the team's spirits and kept their Euro 2024 campaign alive.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Cologne Stadium in Germany.
All four teams in Group E now have three points, setting up crucial matches in the final round of the group stage.
